Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 02:24AM christine1000 wrote: JHI CarCharm - yes, for the first month: Week 1 TCH Week 2 H Week 3 H Week 4 TCH Week 7 TCH Week 11 TCH Week 14 TCH Week 17 TCH Then- Herceptin every three weeks for a year.  How did it go? How long was your infusion?  How did you feel?  Any side meds for naseau?  I heard this is easier than ACT, but more tiresome.  Love, Christine

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2009 11:18AM - edited Sep 20, 2009 10:15AM by christine1000 Sanaisa - is the hydration IV something you get before, during, or after chemo?  It sounds from your post like a whole day before?
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 12:22AM christine1000 wrote: Hi - I start next week (September 3rd) HCT - 6 rounds every three weeks, then a year of Herceptin.  This is my 2nd dx - 1st time in 2000 and had ACT - however, this tumor was HER2+ - I went for a bilateral mastectomy with immediate reconstruction.  The new breasts look pretty good - the right one still needs some pumping up (the tissue expander).  The tummy tissue was used to make the new left breast.  I am VERY nervous about starting chemo again, as I thought I had put this all behind me.  But I have a great family, friends, and church to help out, and I thought I would hook up with some other chemo people so we can rally together - Love, Christine
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2009 01:46AM christine1000 wrote: Hi - Does anyone know about Carboplatin, Herceptin, Taxotere? I think there is another thread on this website. I have Amend that I plan to take - I did not do well with the steriod that I had 9 years ago and opted out on the 4th round, got sick, but at least I wasn't jumpy.

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2009 10:16AM christine1000 wrote: Hi - one down, 5 more to go.  I got really sick about 8-9 days out from TCH, sore throat, fever, bad tummy and I was probably neutropenic, so my doctor is going to give me a Neupogen shot.  Has anyone had this and what if any side effects (positive or negative) did you have - thank you, Christine

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 02:53PM christine1000 wrote: Hi , I now have learned that a PICC is different than a port - mine will be under the arm all inside.  It is called a vital port - made by Cook www.cookmedical.com/di/datasheet.do?=id4379 It is very small, like a bullet under my arm - (feels like one, too, right now!)
Posts.Title: Port for infusions- in arm christine1000 Kodapants

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2009 02:38PM christine1000 wrote: Hi - I had the port in my arm yesterday - it does not stick out.  It isn't a pick line.  It is more like an electrical plug outlet that they will insert the infusion thingy into - it literally feels and looks like a little bullet under the skin.  No tubes, etc.  It is very very sore, but I am glad I have it in my arm.  I have enough scars on my chest for now.  Thanks everyone!
Posts.Title: Port for infusions- in arm christine1000 Kodapants
